intro: Tripterygium forrestii var. execum, commonly known as the Chinese thunder god vine, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Cucurbitaceae and is characterized by its climbing habit and distinctive, lobed leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are followed by orange-red fruits containing toxic seeds. It is known for its medicinal properties, though it contains potent compounds that can be harmful if misused. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject in both horticulture and pharmacology.
